article_title: Medicare's Bundled Fees Hit Knee, Hip Replacements

article_metadata.description: Beginning April 1, hospitals and doctors in 67 regions – one in every five U.S. metro areas – will be at risk for all Medicare spending for hip and knee replacements covered by the health insurance program for the elderly as the Obama administration rolls out a major bundled payment initiative as part of the move away from fee-for-service medicine.
article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen

og.description: Beginning April 1, hospitals and doctors in 67 regions – one in every five U.S. metro areas – will be at risk for all Medicare spending for hip and knee replacements covered by the health insurance program for the elderly as the Obama administration rolls out a major bundled payment initiative as part of the move away from fee-for-service medicine.
